item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "God, everything about him radiated sex, from the strength in his body to the way he moved to the smell of his skin." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "And he’d cozied up to a lightning strike once or twice before." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "Oh…man. She was dressed for love, as far as he was concerned: Flannel pajama bottoms with stars and moons on them. Little white T-shirt. Floppy suede moccasins." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "You are the one. For her, you are the one." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "He tapped the artificial leg. “I am not whole.” True, she thought sadly. He was not whole, although it had nothing to do with him missing part of a limb." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "Nalla blinked and waved his finger and transformed him: Everything stopped as she moved not just his hand, but his heart." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "God, they sounded like two solicitous Victorians talking about sex." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "he wanted to be like Tohr. Heading out into the corridor, it was funny to have that running through his brain again, and its return kind of righted the world: Ever since he’d first met the guy, whether it was the Brother’s size, or his intelligence, or the way he treated his female, or how he fought, or even the deep sound of his voice . . . John had wanted to be like Tohr. This was good. This was . . . right." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "dessert place that was open until one a.m. and served liquor along with chocolate thingies draped in whatever topped with blah-blah-blah on a bed of poached uh-huh, yeah." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "Except cats couldn’t read minds, of course." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "Wrath would always come first for him. It was true for all the Brothers. And considering what Wrath had done to the game room, that was not a bad thing." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "Running her fingertips across the complicated edging of the desk, she discovered that the curlicues actually formed a vine. And there were dates inscribed along the leaves. . . . The Kings and the queens. Their children." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Margaret add a quote by Lara Adrian
item.description: "Mama used to say it was a faerie’s kiss.” Gideon stepped toward her where she sat on the old wooden chair. He gave a mild shrug. “Something made you and those others born with that mark different from other women. Who’s to say it wasn’t faeries?" -- Lara Adrian

item.title: Margaret add a quote by Nalini Singh
item.description: "year by year, I see more and more darkness creep into their world. They’re slowly going beyond cold, to a place that makes me scared for the Psy race as a whole." -- Nalini Singh
